title: Congress Needs to Get Back to Regular Order
sub_head: Reconciliation wasn’t meant to be the vehicle for social change.
body:
Henry David Thoreau offered this advice from Walden Pond in 1848: “Simplify, simplify.” Ralph Waldo Emerson replied that “Simplify” would have been enough.
The legislative branch of the U.S. government has stopped doing the simple things. There are 435 representatives and 100 senators. For an entity of that size to function, sensible rules must govern the careful consideration of legislation. That process is called “regular order.”
